text: It seems like a big part of the problem with the rails situation is the left-pad thing, that a package maintainer can yank their versions at-will and thus suddenly break all the downstream code. I think from an ecosystem-health perspective our way is much better (i.e. to yank or remove versions you need to make a PR that gets approved/merged by registry maintainers).
